Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Aquarium \A*qua"ri*um\, n.; pl. E. {Aquariums}, L. {Aquaria}. [L. See {Aquarius}, {Ewer}.] An artificial pond, or a globe or tank (usually with glass sides), in which living specimens of aquatic animals or plants are kept. [1913 Webster] ||
aquarium n : a tank or pool or bowl filled with water for keeping live fish and underwater animals [syn: {fish tank}, {marine museum}] [also: {aquaria} (pl)]
